mainBoard.originalText:
Choose one or both —
• Tap target creature.

rulings.text: You choose which mode you’re using—or that you’re using both modes—as you’re casting the spell. Once this choice is made, it can’t be changed later while the spell is on the stack.
If you choose both modes, they can each target the same creature or they can target different creatures.
Winterflame won’t affect any target that’s illegal as it tries to resolve. If you choose to use both modes and both targets are illegal at that time, Winterflame won’t resolve.

rulings.text: You can’t cast Cunning Strike unless you target both a creature and a player. If one target (but not both) is illegal as Cunning Strike resolves, it deals damage to the remaining legal target and you draw a card. If both targets are illegal, the spell won’t resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won’t draw a card in that case.

mainBoard.name: Quiet Contemplation
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, tap target creature an opponent controls and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: You decide whether to pay {1} as the triggered ability resolves.
The ability can target a creature that’s already tapped. It still won’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.

The ability tracks the creature, but not its controller. If the creature changes controllers before its first controller’s next untap step has come around, then it won’t untap during its new controller’s next untap step.
